segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit PNP Activity, which determines when plug and play detects an external device.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the advanced security audit policy setting, Audit PNP Activity, which determines when plug and play detects an external device.

segment.source: Audit PNP Activity determines when Plug and Play detects an external device.
segment.target: Audit PNP Activity determines when Plug and Play detects an external device.

segment.source: A PnP audit event can be used to track down changes in system hardware and will be logged on the machine where the change took place.
segment.target: A PnP audit event can be used to track down changes in system hardware and will be logged on the machine where the change took place.

segment.source: For example, when a keyboard is plugged into a computer, a PnP event is triggered.
segment.target: For example, when a keyboard is plugged into a computer, a PnP event is triggered.

segment.source: Event volume: Varies, depending on how the computer is used.
segment.target: Event volume: Varies, depending on how the computer is used.

segment.source: This subcategory will help identify when and which Plug and Play device was attached, enabled, disabled or restricted by device installation policy.
segment.target: This subcategory will help identify when and which Plug and Play device was attached, enabled, disabled or restricted by device installation policy.

segment.source: You can track, for example, whether a USB flash drive or stick was attached to a domain controller, which is typically not allowed.
segment.target: You can track, for example, whether a USB flash drive or stick was attached to a domain controller, which is typically not allowed.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: This subcategory will help identify when and which Plug and Play device was attached, enabled, disabled or restricted by device installation policy.
segment.target: This subcategory will help identify when and which Plug and Play device was attached, enabled, disabled or restricted by device installation policy.

segment.source: You can track, for example, whether a USB flash drive or stick was attached to a critical server, which is typically not allowed.
segment.target: You can track, for example, whether a USB flash drive or stick was attached to a critical server, which is typically not allowed.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: This subcategory will help identify when and which Plug and Play device was attached, enabled, disabled or restricted by device installation policy.
segment.target: This subcategory will help identify when and which Plug and Play device was attached, enabled, disabled or restricted by device installation policy.

segment.source: You can track, for example, whether a USB flash drive or stick was attached to an administrative workstation or VIP workstation.
segment.target: You can track, for example, whether a USB flash drive or stick was attached to an administrative workstation or VIP workstation.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: 6416(S): A new external device was recognized by the System
segment.target: 6416(S): A new external device was recognized by the System

segment.source: 6419(S): A request was made to disable a device
segment.target: 6419(S): A request was made to disable a device

segment.source: 6421(S): A request was made to enable a device.
segment.target: 6421(S): A request was made to enable a device.

segment.source: 6423(S): The installation of this device is forbidden by system policy.
segment.target: 6423(S): The installation of this device is forbidden by system policy.

segment.source: 6424(S): The installation of this device was allowed, after having previously been forbidden by policy.
segment.target: 6424(S): The installation of this device was allowed, after having previously been forbidden by policy.
